title.narrative: Media for Transparent and Accountable Governance (M-TAG)

description.narrative: (Georgia): M-TAG works with competitively selected group of 14 media organizations throughout Georgia to concurrently increase their capacity in content production, web publishing, and business operations. M-TAG works with media partners to provide fact-based reporting and analysis, thus helping the audience to discern disinformation and propaganda and combat anti-Western sentiment M-TAG supports raising reporting standards across the journalism profession by providing operational funds to Ethics Charter and Multimedia Education Center (MEC), to acquire industry-relevant and hands-on production skills. M-TAG helps media partners keep ethnic minority communities and communities affected by conflict on both sides of Administrative Boundary Line informed and provides them with platforms for expression and exchange of ideas and information.With FY 2019 Funds the program will support regional outlets to disseminate COVID-19 related critical pandemic, social or political information in a timely manner. M-TAG will support regional media outlets, including those covering minority communities with language appropriate content, through content production grants and technical assistance to ensure information about continued vigilance, re-emergence and response and recovery efforts and opportunities is well communicated to Georgia's citizens. M-TAG will also support media outlets to analyze and report of COVID-19 response and recovery efforts and communicate citizen's concerns to decision makers at the local and central levels. M-TAG will continue to assist media outlets to improve their online presence, including website development, multimedia content production, online advertising, analytics, editorial management, and management of online TV studios. In addition, the program will continue to support the Georgian Charter of Journalistic Ethics and the Multimedia Education Center, two key institutions that promote high standards in Georgia's media sector.. .

title.narrative: Advancing CSO Capacities and Engaging Society for Sustainability (ACCESS)

description.narrative: (Georgia): .USAID's Advancing Civil Society Capacities and Engaging Society for Sustainability (ACCESS) activity works to increase citizen engagement with Georgian civil society organizations (CSOs) from across the democratic spectrum. The activity, improves organizational and technical capacity of CSOs to monitor and influence government policies and processes in a non-partisan manner. ACCESS achieves these outcomes through a combination of small grants, trainings, and technical assistance to local organizations; and by supporting the Network of Centers for Civic Engagement in 10 cities, which operate as politically neutral gathering spaces for public discourse on issues of relevant to the Georgian public. By enabling a more constituent-connected, organizationally mature cadre of CSOs, activities assist CSOs to become legitimate representatives of citizens' concerns.With FY 2019 funds ACCESS will expand COVID-19-related programming to address medium and longer-term implications of the pandemic. ACCESS will work with local organizations to continue to build communities' trust in civil society, demonstrate efficient use of resources and encourage community investment in COVID-19 related activities through volunteerism and community resource mobilization. The activity builds the capacity of the civil society sector to contribute to more transparent and accountable governance (ICS MO 1.1) by facilitating dialogue between citizens and their government about key priorities. This activity aligns with U.S. national security interests and supports the U.S. policy priority of promoting American leadership through balanced engagement and increased partnerships with civil society (JSP 3.3 and JRS 4.1). The activity works to counter Russian soft power that discredits civil society. It mitigates democratic backsliding by ensuring an active citizenry and supports the U.S. goals to advance Georgia's Euro-Atlantic integration... .. .. .

description.narrative: (Georgia): Russian occupation of Abkhazia and South Ossetia, borderization along these regions, and discontent in communities with ethnically or religiously marginalized populations are direct threats to Georgia's economic and political stability. By building economic resilience in communities along the administrative boundary line (ABL) and regions with marginalized populations, the Zrda program directly counters malign Kremlin influence, contributes to ongoing economic activity along the ABL, and supports Georgia to restore its territorial integrity...Zrda will build the economic resilience of more than 80 communities by supporting at least 800 micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) to acquire equipment and certifications to increase productive capacity and meet international quality standards for goods and services. Zrda will also support the GOG agencies to promote new technologies and innovation; strengthen the public and private sector extension systems; extend digital marketing and electronic matchmaking services between buyers, producers, and service providers; and develop public-private partnerships to build economic opportunities in targeted communities. In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Zrda will support Georgia's hospitality businesses across 17 municipalities to implement required sanitary regulations...Zrda will provide $1.3 million in training, grants, and technical assistance to advance USAID/Georgia's CDCS DO1: Resilience to external malign influence strengthened (CAATSA Goal 8) and DO3: Inclusive high-value employment opportunities through increased economic growth. By co-investing with the private sector and the GOG to incentivize new business development along the ABL (JRS 2.3.1), Zrda ensures effectiveness to the American taxpayer (JSP 4), promotes American leadership through balanced engagement (JSP 3.3), and mobilizes additional resources to advance Georgia's self-reliance (JRS 5.2.1)... .. .

description.narrative: (Georgia): .Good Governance Initiative (GGI) is designed to support the GOG in strengthening transparency, accountability, and effectiveness of select governance and service delivery systems to achieve: improved administrative and financial management of public institutions; improved access to independent, reliable and balanced information on government performance; strengthened policy development and lawmaking; and strengthened institutional oversight of GOG. GGI's government counterparts include the Prime Minister's Office; the Ministries of Finance, Health, Justice, and Regional Development; Parliament; the State Audit Office; Public Defender's and State Inspector's Offices and select local governments. Interventions will work with government and civil society representatives to enhance public participation, public awareness and monitoring of public administration and parliamentary strengthening reforms. The activity will have emphasis on COVID19 response. ..Using FY 2019 funds, GGI's activities will be focused on:.Supporting the GoG in COVID19 response through policy research in the governance areas impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic; analysis of government operations during the pandemic; mapping of public services and developing recommendations for operationalizing essential public services to be accessible remotely; developing guidelines for the operation of civil service during the crisis; supporting remote operations of the Parliament; etc. Supporting the implementation of the Local Government Decentralization Strategy (2020-2025) by providing necessary technical assistance in select areas.Supporting the implementation of Anti-Corruption Action Plan (2019-2020) and Open Government Partnership Action Plans in select municipalities.Improving state oversight through supporting the Parliament and the State Audit Office as well as building internal control functions of the government agencies... .

title.narrative: Enhance Non-Governmental Actors and Grassroots Engagement (ENGAGE)

description.narrative: (Ukraine): ENGAGE supports Ukrainian civil society organizations (CSOs) from across the democratic spectrum to enhance citizen awareness of, and participation in, civic action at the national, regional, and local levels (ICS 2.2). The ongoing activity helps to counter Russian propaganda by helping CSOs represent citizen concerns, provide oversight, and affect policy (JRS 4.4). With FY 20 funding, ENGAGE will: enhance civic education by working with government ministries and civil society from across the democratic spectrum to design and pilot civic education curricula; foster effective national, regional, and local civic coalitions by convening CSOs around core issues and building the capacity of national and local partners to collaborate effectively; improve the organizational capacity of partner CSOs by expanding the number of intermediary support organizations building capacity and improving the quality and quantity of skills on offer; and develop local capacity to ensure long-term civic engagement in democratic reforms by developing a vision for sector sustainability and supporting its realization..USAID is planning to modify this award to continue for an additional 2-3 years this critical civic assistance in the dynamic COVID and political environment..CAATSA 5: Independent Media and Civil Society $903,698.. .

title.narrative: HealthLink: Accelerating Ukraine's Efforts to End HIV Activity

description.narrative: The HealthLink Project, Accelerating Ukraines Efforts to End HIV, has started in October 2017. All efforts of the project are focused on accelerating the process of overcoming the HIV epidemic in Ukraine due to an opportunity of testing for HIV quickly and securely and starting the treatment as soon as possible. The project is being implemented by the Alliance for Public Health, in partnership with the All-Ukrainian Network of PLWH, funded by the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID). The goal of the project is to improve access of people living with HIV and people at high risk of infection to high-quality services for the infection prevention and treatment and high-quality medical and social support, as well as reduction of stigma and discrimination of people living with HIV from the side of medical workers. In translation from English, the name of the project literally means link (connection) to health.

participating-org.narrative: All Ukrainian Network of People Living with HIV/AIDS

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Political Processes Program Follow-on will continue to advance the U.S. government's objective of an inclusive and accountable democracy by facilitating greater popular participation in political processes across all levels of government and by enabling increased mutual accountability between citizens and government. The activity works by helping political parties and parliamentary factions to better identify and respond to citizen concerns, and to communicate their work through a variety of outreach platforms and mechanisms. Funds will also support: strengthening political parties; helping the central election commission to improve the organization of elections; supporting organizational development of domestic election monitoring organizations, including intensive capacity building and technical support in conducting short- and long-term election observation; and supporting leadership opportunities and civic education to increase inclusion of historically underserved and disenfranchised groups, including youth and women and people with disabilities. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1: Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy.

participating-org.narrative: Consortium for Elections and Political Process Strengthening

title.narrative: Cultivating Media Independence (CMI) Initiative Activity in the Kyrgyz Republic, Media-K

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Media-K initiative will continue to support the development of a more professional, financially viable, and independent media sector. This activity will result in media outlets which better serve the public interest by providing access to diverse and balanced information and analyses about the issues that are of most concern to citizens, while providing a counterweight to state-funded media. This activity will include the provision of training, technical expertise, and mentoring to Kyrgyzstani journalists, media outlets, and production companies to help them build their skills and increase the production of high-quality domestic content. The activity will stimulate the production of domestic content that responds to audience demand, strengthen the ability of targeted media outlets to use audience research to attract more advertising, and bring together disparate stakeholders to advocate for a healthy enabling environment for media businesses. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1: Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy.

Objectives for Kyrgyz Republic: Media-K aims to strengthen the professionalism and independence of media in the Kyrgyz Republic in order to ensure that citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic have greater access to diverse and balanced information, are less vulnerable to media bias, and are empowered to make better-informed civic decisions that reflect their communities’ priorities to best serve the public interest.

description.narrative: (West Bank and Gaza): ..The activity will create a path for vulnerable populations in Gaza to become more resilient and self-reliant by providing basic humanitarian commodities and increasing employment opportunities. ..Using FY 2020 funds, USAID will provide assistance which includes cash for work opportunities, cash-for-internship and cash-for-apprenticeship programs, and entrepreneurship training. Interventions also include start up grants, and support to existing small businesses through small capital grants. The assistance will also provide food and non-food vouchers assistance. The activity will provide equal opportunities to men and women with a focus on youth and new graduates.........

sector.narrative: Relief co-ordination; protection and support services

title.narrative: Afghanistan's Measure for Accountability and Transparency ( AMANAT)

description.narrative: (Afghanistan): With FY 2020 resources, USAID will continue to implement Afghanistan's Measure for Accountability and Transparency (AMANAT) activity. AMANAT aims to strengthen the Government of Afghanistan (GOA) institutions and civil society organizations (CSOs) to identify vulnerabilities to corruption in the delivery of public services, and develop activities to address these vulnerabilities...This program is designed to: 1) improve the performance, legitimacy, and technical capacity of the GoA to reduce and prevent corruption in government public services and functions; 2) support selected GoA institutions with technical assistance for procedural reforms based on recommendations identified in the vulnerabilities to corruption assessments; 3) strengthen local CSOs' capacity to test and monitor the effectiveness of those reforms and to advocate for their implementation where necessary; 4) train CSOs to perform watchdog functions to hold the government accountable to the public by analyzing anti-corruption shortcomings in legislation, conducting social auditing, and supporting citizen monitoring; and 5) support the Ministry of Public Health's current COVID-19 campaign through the dissemination of anti-corruption messaging in Kabul and seven provinces, through a 3-month (June 15 - September 15) Social Behavior Change Communication and Distance Learning Campaign..

Objectives for Afghanistan: Project objectives include: Support selected government institutions in facilitated self-assessments to identify corruption risks in their internal procedures. Strengthen internal audit functions in the selected government agencies. Work closely with central government agencies, use business process reengineering and other techniques to develop tailored corruption risk mitigation plans and support their implementation. Monitor implementation of these reforms over time to promote learning and adaptation. Mobilize civil society groups in Kabul and selected provinces to act as “government watchdogs” to address corruption. Enable CSOs to analyze shortcomings in legislation addressing corruption. Support CSO initiatives that increase public awareness, advocacy, monitoring and oversight activities through a grants program.
